channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Henry Cuellar, Texas Representative, and His Wife Indicted on Bribery Charges
item.description: Mr. Cuellar and his wife are accused of accepting bribes from a bank in Mexico City and from an oil and gas company owned by Azerbaijan. He has maintained they are innocent.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Trade and Diplomatic Moves Deepen Israel’s Isolation
item.description: Turkey’s decision to suspend trade with Israel came after some countries downgraded or cut ties. But key allies including the U.S. remain supportive.

item.title: Most Americans believe it will take over two decades to pay off their student loans
item.description: What some call the best four years of your life might end up leaving a decades-long aftertaste.

item.title: How ‘Star Wars’ Fan Edits Saved the Original Movies
item.description: George Lucas wants them to fade into oblivion. But some rebel fans spent more than a decade digitally restoring the original “Star Wars” trilogy, preserving the movies as they were shown in theaters.

item.title: Henry Cuellar, Texas Representative, and His Wife Indicted on Bribery Charges
item.description: Mr. Cuellar and his wife are accused of accepting bribes from a bank in Mexico City and from an oil and gas company owned by Azerbaijan. He has maintained they are innocent.

item.title: I’m paid $14 an hour to rate AI-generated Google search results. Subcontractors like me do key work but don’t get fair wages or benefits
item.description: Quality raters are critical to ensuring that Google search results aren’t littered with fraudulent or dangerous results.

item.title: Political Furor Over U.S. Steel Bid Puts Cfius in Spotlight
item.description: Backlash over the deal has echoes of the 1980s when Nippon Steel tried and failed to buy another American metal company.

item.title: U.K. Local Elections Show Sharp Setbacks for Conservatives
item.description: The scale of the losses suffered by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s party sent an ominous message about its chances in an upcoming general election.

item.title: It’s ‘just what the Fed chair wanted’ as the economy adds fewer jobs and unemployment rises to 3.9%
item.description: “For those grappling with renewed stagflation fears, this payrolls report supports what Powell said earlier this week about not seeing the ‘stag’ or the ‘-flation’ right now,” J.P. Morgan’s Elyse Ausenbaugh noted.

item.title: Mike Repole, Horse Racing’s Loudest Critic, Is Kentucky Derby Favorite
item.description: The brash owner Mike Repole will take a break from tweaking horse racing’s powers when his colt Fierceness runs in the Kentucky Derby on Saturday.

item.title: A Gaza Doctor Has Died in Israeli Custody, Palestinian Groups Say
item.description: Israel has not offered an explanation for the death of Dr. Adnan Ahmad Albursh, chief of orthopedics at Al-Shifa hospital, four months after he was first detained.

item.title: Trump Media's accounting firm accused of massive fraud as a 'sham audit mill' that created false papers, did nonexistent work, and fabricated meetings
item.description: Trump Media “looks forward to working with new auditing partners in accordance with today’s SEC order,” a representative for the company said.

item.title: TikTok, Facing US Ban, Tells Advertisers It Won’t Back Down
item.description: Hundreds of marketers and ad agency types flocked to TikTok’s annual sales presentation after a new law put its future in question.

item.title: Gas Stove Pollution Risk Is Greatest in Smaller Homes, Study Finds
item.description: Gas-burning ranges, a significant contributor to indoor pollution, can produce and spread particularly high levels of some pollutants in smaller spaces.

item.title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman doesn’t care how much AGI will cost: Even if he spends $50 billion a year, some breakthroughs for mankind are priceless
item.description: Altman is more worried about how quickly society can adapt to the technology: “One thing we’ve learned is that AI and surprise don’t go well together.”
